storyInfo: Within the deceasd Dublinn soldiers, Bagpipe recognizes the Arts she saw before at County Hillock. With a plea from Fionn, Reed agrees to escort the Taran refugees in their escape from capture.

attributes.content: What's goin' on with these soldiers?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: They go down without puttin' up a proper fight, and they don't even react to us yellin'.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: They're already dead. They've been dead for... over 48 hours.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Chenchen, I know you're a copper, you're not mistaken when you see things, but these people were clearly standin' before we knocked them down, right?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: I saw a kind of Arts, among Reunion's ranks, that could control other people.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: But this and that don't resemble each other. If Amiya... if Rhodes Island's Cautus was here, she might be able to feel out the difference better than me.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: That kind of Arts refuted emotion and thought. It took living Sarkaz warriors and wore them down into walking weapons.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: But these Dublinn soldiers are dead without a doubt... There's just some intense emotion that's still burning in them, even after they've died.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Burning?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: It's just a feeling.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: If this Arts had a definite form, if I used my Chi Xiao to cut through it, I'd imagine I'd be cutting through a fireball.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Wait, I've seen...
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Purple flames.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Strange purple flames, burnin' in the eyes of dead soldiers...
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: I saw the Arts you're describin', back in County Hillock.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: I haven't seen it since... not once, all this time! Chenchen, we're almost there, aren't we? That Caster leadin' the spectre force in County Hillock, she's got to be somewhere around here!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: I'll never forget how she looked... I'm dead sure I'll recognize her if I see her again, and when I do, I can find out the truth about Dublinn.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Right.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Come on, then! We need to keep askin' around! Villagers, maybe caravans who've passed by... We'll find them, even if they're not the spectres for real!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Phew.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Patrol came brutally fast. It's lucky we've got good eyes on us.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Hah, you think those Victorian eejits say hello before they come snatching?
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: You lot move ahead, I'll take a proper count. Been worried we left somebody behind in all that panic just now...
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Oh, that's right! Where's the doctor? Did nobody fetch her?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Didn't she say she was off by herself this morning? I'm not minding her business.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: Besides, it's not going to be an issue if a Viccy soldier nabs her, right? She's not wanted.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: Look, she is! We got her involved in all this last night!
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: It was dark out and the soldiers probably didn't catch her face properly, but how many Vouivre have you ever seen around here?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Well, if you can't help her, what's the point dossing about fretting the whole day?
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: Wait. Hold on, Caireann's here... Selmon, you did that on purpose.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: You lied to her saying we'd lost track of a friend, and could she go looking...
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Why? She was kind enough to save us, and share us some medicine... And you just left her for the army lot to snap up?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: You don't get it? We leave her behind to attract attention, and that gives us a safe getaway for the time being.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: And she won't say much vital even if she's caught. She doesn't even know which way we're going, let alone the fact we're looking for Dublinn.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: But... But she could die!
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Yeah. She went off alone. She'll run into the patrol sooner or later.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: We should've taken all her luggage while we had the chance. Wouldn't fall into those Victorian scumbags' hands, at least.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: It was her choice, Fionn. Did you not see her face when she saw me?
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: She KNEW Dublinn, but never had no kindness for it. And she spoke standard Victorian.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: Her sort hate us more than real Victorians do.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: I can't swallow that, Selmon. I trust my intuition for people.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Relax, madam.
attributes.name: Patrol Captain

attributes.content: I'm not—familiar with what's gone on here.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I know. You're not a Dublinn ally. You just panicked for a bit, and got mixed up with those insurrectionists.
attributes.name: Patrol Captain

attributes.content: (Taran) You've killed Dublinns.
attributes.name: Patrol Captain

attributes.content: You understood that. We're not mistaken, then. There's very few Vouivre around these parts who know Taran.
attributes.name: Patrol Captain

attributes.content: Where did that Dublinn soldier take you lot, last night?
attributes.name: Patrol Captain

attributes.content: No... they're not Dublinn, and they don't have anything to do with Dublinn either.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: And I've never killed anyone from Dublinn before. You've gotten something wrong.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: You can be honest here. You won't pay for it, so you don't need to fear it.
attributes.name: Patrol Captain

attributes.content: The land around here has been under strict surveillance by the barracks. The Marquess of Trent has no plans to dither like some nobility has, letting Dublinn stir up flames all over the place.
attributes.name: Patrol Captain

attributes.content: That's why we could even tell who you were.
attributes.name: Patrol Captain

attributes.content: Residents of a different village, close to Trent's cityway, reported news of Dublinn to the barracks a few days ago.
attributes.name: Patrol Captain

attributes.content: But those Dublinn soldiers, before they could attack the village, were all felled by a white-haired Vouivre.
attributes.name: Patrol Captain

attributes.content: Would we be able to turn on the tap, so to speak? We'd like to query your identity, motive, as well as last night's arson which held similarities to Dublinn MO...
attributes.name: Patrol Captain

attributes.content: —Hold it! Are you trying to flee?
attributes.name: Patrol Captain

attributes.content: Stop her! This Vouivre is scared of going on record! There's something afoot with her!
attributes.name: Patrol Captain

attributes.content: —S-She broke my saber?! What kind of strength does she...?!
attributes.name: Patrol Soldier

attributes.content: I've told you—everything I can tell you. Let me leave...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: It'll be best for us.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: You must be of a kind with those wretches, if you're so protective of them. Bumptious Tara rabble, the lot of you.
attributes.name: Patrol Captain

attributes.content: Fire! A few bolts aren't enough to kill a Vouivre! Suppress her first!
attributes.name: Patrol Captain

attributes.content: Why... do you hate them so much? You're a—Taran yourself...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Shut up! You are NOT—to address me with that word!
attributes.name: Patrol Captain

attributes.content: So anyone who spoke Taran since childhood IS a Taran? I certainly never heard of the 'Taran' people when I was young!
attributes.name: Patrol Captain

attributes.content: If you're the one who repelled those Dublinns, you should get it into your head that 'Taran' is just an excuse of a moniker these bandits use to destroy the order. And once you do, you draw a clean line between yourself and them.
attributes.name: Patrol Captain

attributes.content: ...'It was the erosion of the Tarans by Victoria's vain stylings, that led so many to fall to banditry.'
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: A mentor... told me this, many years ago.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I'm sorry.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Hah, hah... you're hesitating. You're scared of even stabbing people with your pike there.
attributes.name: Patrol Captain

attributes.content: —Are you looking down on me, is that it?
attributes.name: Patrol Captain

attributes.content: It was because, in an instant, they'd become ash upon the barrens.
Go, Loughshinny. If you don't want what you do to be discovered, then the best way is to dispose of all eyewitnesses.
attributes.name: 'The Leader'

attributes.content: No, I wouldn't do that.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Urgh—!
attributes.name: Patrol Captain

attributes.content: Captain!
attributes.name: Patrol Soldier

attributes.content: Re... Retreat with the captain! Report this upstairs, request backup!
attributes.name: Patrol Soldier

attributes.content: It's okay. They won't—catch up to me.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I'll be leaving this place very soon. I know the speed—at which the Victorian Army mobilizes.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: This is—far from wrong to do.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: —Who's there?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: She thrusts her spear forth in vigilance.
—Its point hovers over some shrubbery.
It's me, it's me...
attributes.name: Voice Behind a Shrub

attributes.content: It's me, I'm not going to hurt you.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Yes, I'm very well aware the County Trent won't be changing its entire course just for a single order, which is why we're willing to push back the delivery date and wait for the nomadic city to come closer.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Of course, only mines with royal approval could provide Originium fuel of such high purity, hence my being so very thankful for the Marquess of Trent's friendly attitude to us.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: I imagine we're all very happy with this business partnership.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Your secretary has left with the signed contract, Mr. Hughes.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: He'll deliver it back to the office. Please, I ask you trust him to properly handle such a vital agreement.
attributes.name: Hughes

attributes.content: No, no no no, I don't mean to doubt his management abilities.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: But rather, doesn't this imply you have more pressing matters to discuss with me personally than the contract, mmm?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: After all, you did choose this secluded little getaway, and dismiss your servants too.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Quite right, it's no surprise you'd surmise, haha. I had all these arrangements laid out specifically to convey my good faith to you. My wish is that...
attributes.name: Hughes

attributes.content: our ensuing conversation will be founded on our mutual friendship from our time studying at the Royal Guard together, Lo—
attributes.name: Hughes

attributes.content: Shh.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: How funny you should remember that name.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Haha... well, you do know how famous she was at the ball.
attributes.name: Hughes

attributes.content: Oh, my, does it not make sense that her type could topple over and not get up while dead drunk in some godforsaken place?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Yes, I trust the vast majority have forgotten all about her. Whether it was a true accident or some other party's orchestration, everyone knew not to stick their noses into it.
attributes.name: Hughes

attributes.content: I much thank you for so lavishly feigning surprise.
attributes.name: Hughes

attributes.content: My surprise happens to contain a kernel of sincerity.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Bringing up a name vanished from the school, a name with no record anywhere in Victoria of existing... You're practically bidding 'spectres' to come.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Hm, you're not wrong.
attributes.name: Hughes

attributes.content: Then let me be bold. Why, may I ask, did you contact me of your own accord? I'm no more than a minor aristocrat making minor deals with all the mercantile breadth. I couldn't do anything about the info you've hinted at.
attributes.name: Hughes

attributes.content: Miss Informant, are you looking to circumvent your higher-ups to please your own swollen ambitions, or are you...
attributes.name: Hughes

attributes.content: If you've made full sense of this conversation, it wouldn't do me any more favors playing the fool, would it.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: The gist of it is, I'm here specifically, given our previous time studying at the Royal Guard, to offer you... and the two who've been searching for the spectre force this whole time, a little warning.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: You knew...
attributes.name: Hughes

attributes.content: Mm, yes, of course I knew they came to see you, plus that you helped them pursue a batch of Originium products shipped to County Hillock half a year ago.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Some people would sayyyy... you've let slip a little too much.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: I understand how sensitive your position is, and how multifaceted your responsibilities. Rest assured, I would absolutely never leak any of this classified information to anyone.
attributes.name: Hughes

attributes.content: As for those two rash students of mine, I'll give them a tact warning to quit while they're ahead.
attributes.name: Hughes

attributes.content: And I'll leave your staff a little head start on their investigation into your order's whereabouts.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: I appreciate your kindness, but being the paltry merchant I am, I fear I shouldn't be privy to too much.
attributes.name: Hughes

attributes.content: No, please, drop the humbleness. After all, you're the vice-chair of your commerce coalition. I'd think the Earl that backs you would very much care about any info you gather doing business.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Is the Iron Duke really so worth depending on, given his sheer silence up to now? You know, it's about time he decided where he stood.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Harmonie, you're not telling me you're Victoria's... no, just who are you serving—
attributes.name: Hughes

attributes.content: —Mr. Hughes, I'd be very happy to receive the contents of our next contract from you... sooner, rather than later.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Sorry, sorry... Really, I'm not here to hurt you, please don't touch me.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: *sigh* I couldn't will myself to come out just now, sorry I didn't help you...
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: What am I on about? You're good enough with your spear there to knock a soldier out in a swing or two. Hardly needing anyone else to help you, haha.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: You should have withdrawn by now.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: We... *sigh* Okay, you guessed as much.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: So, did they leave you behind too?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: They shouldn't... they wouldn't. You can't fight. You'd get caught.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: But you're a trader here—you know so many people. If they treat you unjustly, you have too many methods you could retaliate with...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: No, no. I was actually... running back to bring you along, so you can flee with us.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: I know, I'm a little late for that. I was feeling guilty, and scared of running into the army, and I just kept arguing with myself, and now I'm late.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: It's a good thing you can fight, at least. The army can't get their hands on you.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Er, ma'am, sa... say something. You're frightening me, you really are.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: I am? ...Why?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I really don't know how to apologize to you in any way that makes it better. Honestly, they're a kind bunch usually, it's just life these days has driven us mad...
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: You don't need to say anything... it's fine. I don't mind.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Think of me like... like reeds, growing on the roadside.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I won't poison you, or crush you. At most, you'll feel a little stinging from me.
Who would mind—such a white lie?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: You say that with your hurt written all over your face.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Do... I look that hurt?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: You don't need... to worry about me, but—you do need to flee, quickly.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: After last night's fire, the army will be sure to transfer more people from the city, to search the wilds here.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Er, right, of course...
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: *sigh* There's one more thing, actually. It's a little hard for me to say.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: I know you're telling us to run. But for the past dozen or so days, we've been hounded by the army this way and that like beasts in a hunting ground, just going in circles over the wastes. We can't shake them.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: So if I could ask you one more favor.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Please, help us. Escort us on our journey, so we can catch the carrier truck that saves our lives.
attributes.name: Fionn
